</EFX_NAME_AND_TITLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Other than Javier L&oacute;pez Madrid, who was appointed on February&nbsp;5, 2015 (our date of
	incorporation), each director was appointed on December&nbsp;23, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Other than employment agreements between Globe and
	each of Alan Kestenbaum, Joseph Ragan and Stephen Lebowitz, and an employment agreement between FerroAtl&aacute;ntica and Pedro Larrea Paguaga, there are no service contracts between the officers and directors listed in the table above, on the one
	hand, and us or any of our subsidiaries on the other, providing for benefits upon termination of employment. Other than the individuals listed in the table above, we have no other director or manager.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	60
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage63"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	There are no family relationship between our executive officers and directors,
	except that Javier L&oacute;pez Madrid is married to the sister of Juan Villar-Mir de Fuentes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Set forth below is a brief biography of each of our
	executive officers and directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Alan Kestenbaum
</B>
	has served as a director, Executive Chairman and Principal
	Executive Officer since December&nbsp;23, 2015. He has served as Executive Chairman and director of Globe since its inception in December 2004, and served as Chief Executive Officer from its inception through May 2008 and from August&nbsp;31, 2015
	until the closing of the Business Combination. From June 2004, Mr.&nbsp;Kestenbaum served as Chairman of Globe Metallurgical, Inc., until its acquisition by Globe in November 2006. He has over 30 years of experience in metals including finance,
	distribution, trading and manufacturing. Mr.&nbsp;Kestenbaum is a founder and was the Chief Executive Officer of Marco International Corp. and its affiliates, a finance trading group specializing in metals, minerals and other raw materials, founded
	in 1985. Mr.&nbsp;Kestenbaum began his career in metals with Glencore, Inc. and Philipp Brothers in New York City. He received his B.A. degree in Economics cum laude from Yeshiva University, New York.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Javier L&oacute;pez Madrid
</B>
	has served as a director since our inception in February 2015 and has served as Executive
	Vice-Chairman since December&nbsp;23, 2015. He is Chief Executive Officer of Grupo VM. He is founder and chairman of the venture group Siacapital and Tressis, Spain&#146;s largest independent private bank. In addition to his professional activities,
	he is also a member of the World Economic Forum, Group of Fifty and a board member of Fundaci&oacute;n Juan Miguel Villar Mir. Mr.&nbsp;L&oacute;pez Madrid holds a Master in law and business from ICADE University.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Pedro Larrea Paguaga
</B>
	has served as the Chief Executive Officer since December&nbsp;23, 2015. He was Chairman and CEO
	of Grupo FerroAtl&aacute;ntica since December 2012, and served in that role until the closing of the Business Combination. He joined Grupo FerroAtl&aacute;ntica as CEO in 2011. Before joining Grupo FerroAtl&aacute;ntica, for thirteen years
	(1996-2009), he worked in Endesa, the biggest power company in Spain and Latin America, where he reached the position of Chairman and CEO of Endesa Latinoam&eacute;rica, with total revenues above 8 bn&#128; and EBITDA above 3 bn&#128;. He served in
	the Board of Directors of Enersis (2007-2009) and Endesa Chile (1999-2002 and 2006-2007), both public Chilean companies listed on the NYSE. Pedro Larrea has also worked in management consulting firms PwC (2010-2011), where he lead the energy sector
	practice in Spain, and McKinsey&nbsp;&amp; Company, in Spain, Latin America and the USA (1989-1995). Mr.&nbsp;Larrea holds a Mining Engineer degree (MSc equivalent) from Universidad Polit&eacute;cnica de Madrid (graduated with honors). He also holds
	an MBA from INSEAD, where he obtained the Henry Ford II award for academic excellence.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Joseph Ragan
</B>
	has served as
	Chief Financial Officer and Principal Accounting Officer since December&nbsp;23, 2015. He joined Globe as Chief Financial Officer in May 2013, and served in that role until the closing of the Business Combination. Prior to that, Mr.&nbsp;Ragan
	served from 2008 to 2013 as Chief Financial Officer for Boart Longyear, the world&#146;s largest drilling services contractor for the global mining sector, operating in more than 40 countries and selling its products in nearly 100 countries. Prior
	to joining Boart Longyear, he held the position of Chief Financial Officer for the GTSI Corporation, a leading technology solutions provider for the public sector listed on NASDAQ. Earlier in his career, he held various international and domestic
	finance positions for PSEG, The AES Corporation, and Deloitte and Touche. He received his Bachelor of Science in Accounting from The University of the State of New York, his Master&#146;s degree in Accounting from George Mason University, and was a
	Certified Public Accountant in the commonwealth of Virginia for over 25 years.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Stephen Lebowitz
</B>
	has served as
	Chief Legal Officer since December&nbsp;23, 2015. He served as Chief Legal Officer of Globe from July 2008 until the closing of the Business Combination. Prior to that, from 2001 to 2008, Mr.&nbsp;Lebowitz was in-house counsel to BP p.l.c.&#146;s
	jet fuel, marine and solar energy divisions. Prior to joining BP, Mr.&nbsp;Lebowitz was in private practice and began his career in the government in the international trade area. Mr.&nbsp;Lebowitz holds a B.A. from the University of Vermont,
	received a law degree from George Washington University, and while overseas as a Fulbright Scholar, obtained an L.L.M. in European law.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Donald G. Barger, Jr.
</B>
	has served as a director since December&nbsp;23, 2015. He is a member of our Compensation
	Committee and serves as the chairman of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee. He served as a member of the Globe board of directors since December 2008 until the closing of the Business Combination and was Chairman of Globe&#146;s Audit
	Committee and Chairman of Globe&#146;s Compensation Committee. Mr.&nbsp;Barger had a successful 36 year business career in manufacturing and services companies. He retired in February 2008 from YRC Worldwide Inc. (formerly Yellow Roadway
	Corporation), one of the world&#146;s largest transportation service providers. Mr.&nbsp;Barger served as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of YRC Worldwide Inc. from December 2000 to August 2007 and from August 2007 until his
	retirement as advisor to the CEO. From March 1998 to December 2000, Mr.&nbsp;Barger was Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Hillenbrand Industries, a provider of services and products for the health care and funeral services industries.
	From 1993 to 1998, Mr.&nbsp;Barger was Vice President of Finance and Chief Financial Officer of Worthington Industries, Inc., a diversified steel processor. Mr.&nbsp;Barger served on the Board of Directors of Gardner Denver, Inc. and was a member of
	the Audit Committee for his entire nineteen year tenure until the company&#146;s sale in July 2013. He served as Chair of the committee seventeen of those years. He also served on the Board of Directors of Quanex Building Products Corporation for
	sixteen years, retiring in February 2012.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	61
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage64"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Additionally, he served on the Audit Committee for fourteen years and was its Chair for most of that time. He also serves on the Board of Directors of Precision Aerospace Components, Inc. On all
	the public company boards on which Mr.&nbsp;Barger served, he was considered a &#147;financial expert&#148; for SEC purposes. Mr.&nbsp;Barger received a B.S. degree from the U.S. Naval Academy and an M.B.A. degree from the University of
	Pennsylvania.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Bruce L. Crockett
</B>
	has served as a director since December&nbsp;23, 2015. He is a member of our
	Audit Committee and the BCA Special Committee. He served as a member of Globe&#146;s board of directors since April 2014 until the closing of the Business Combination and was a member of Globe&#146;s Audit Committee. Mr.&nbsp;Crockett is Chairman of
	the Invesco Mutual Funds Group Board of Directors, and is also a member of the audit, investment and governance committees. He serves as a member of the Investment Company Institute&#146;s Board of Governors and as a director and audit committee
	chair of ALPS Property&nbsp;&amp; Casualty Insurance Company. Mr.&nbsp;Crockett is the chairman of Crockett Technologies Associates and a private investor. Mr.&nbsp;Crockett served as President and Chief Executive Officer of COMSAT Corporation from
	February 1992 until July 1996 and as President and Chief Operating Officer of COMSAT from April 1991 to February 1992. As an employee of COMSAT since 1980, Mr.&nbsp;Crockett held various other operational and financial positions including Vice
	President and Chief Financial Officer. Mr.&nbsp;Crockett served as a director of Ace Limited from 1995 until 2012 and as a director of Captaris, Inc. from 2001 until its acquisition in 2008, and as Chairman from 2003 to 2008. Mr.&nbsp;Crockett is
	also a life trustee of the University of Rochester. Mr.&nbsp;Crockett received an A.B. degree from the University of Rochester, a B.S. degree from the University of Maryland, and an M.B.A. degree from Columbia University and holds an honorary Doctor
	of Law degree from the University of Maryland.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Stuart E. Eizenstat
</B>
	has served as a director since
	December&nbsp;23, 2015. He is a member of our Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee and BCA Special Committee. He served as a director of Globe since February 2008 until the closing of the Business Combination and was the Chairman of
	Globe&#146;s Nominating Committee. Mr.&nbsp;Eizenstat is Senior Counsel of Covington&nbsp;&amp; Burling LLP in Washington, D.C. and heads the law firm&#146;s international practice. He served as Deputy Secretary of the United States Department of
	the Treasury from July 1999 to January 2001. He was Under Secretary of State for Economic, Business and Agricultural Affairs from 1997 to 1999. Mr.&nbsp;Eizenstat served as Under Secretary of Commerce for International Trade from 1996 to 1997 and
	was the U.S. Ambassador to the European Union from 1993 to 1996. During the Clinton Administration he also served as Special Representative of the President and Secretary of State on Holocaust Issues. From 1977 to 1981 he was Chief Domestic Policy
	Advisor in the White House to President Carter. He is a trustee of BlackRock Funds and served as a member of the Board of Directors of Alcatel-Lucent until 2016. He served as a member of the Board of Directors of United Parcel Service from 2005 to
	2015. He serves on the Advisory Board of GML Ltd., and Office of Cherifien de Phosphates. He has received eight honorary doctorate degrees and awards from the United States, French, German, Austrian, Belgian and Israeli governments. He is the author
	of &#147;Imperfect Justice: Looted Assets, Slave Labor, and the Unfinished Business of World War II&#148; and &#147;The Future of the Jews: How Global Forces are Impacting the Jewish People, Israel, and its Relationship with the United States.&#148;
	He currently serves as a Special Adviser to Secretary of State Kerry on Holocaust-Era Issues. Mr.&nbsp;Eizenstat holds a B.A. in Political Science from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and a J.D. from Harvard Law School.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Tom&aacute;s Garc&iacute;a Madrid
</B>
	has served as a director since December&nbsp;23, 2015. He is a member of our
	Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee. Mr.&nbsp;Garc&iacute;a Madrid is the Chief Executive Officer of Grupo Villar Mir, S.A.U. and serves as a Managing Director of the Grupo VM board of directors. He has served on the board of directors of
	Obrasc&oacute;n Huarte Lain, S.A. since 1996. He also has served on the board of Obrascon Huarte Lain Mexico since 2010 and Abertis Infraestructuras, S.A. since 2012. Mr.&nbsp;Garc&iacute;a Madrid holds a Master&#146;s Degree in Civil Engineering
	from the Universidad Polit&eacute;cnica de Madrid and an Masters in Business Administration from Universidad IESE.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Greger Hamilton
</B>
	has served as a director since December&nbsp;23, 2015. He is a member of our Compensation Committee
	and BCA Special Committee and serves as chairman of the Audit Committee. Mr.&nbsp;Hamilton is Managing Partner of Ovington Financial Partners, LTD, a role he has held since 2009. From 2009-2014 he also served as a Partner at European Resolution
	Capital Partners, where he assisted in the restructuring of international banks in 16 countries. Prior to that, he was a Managing Director at Goldman Sachs International, where he worked from 1997-2008. He began his career at McKinsey and Company,
	where he worked from 1990-1997. Mr.&nbsp;Hamilton holds a B.A. in Business Economics and International Commerce from Brown University.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Javier Monz&#243;n
</B>
	has served as a director since December 23, 2015. He is a member of our Audit Committee and serves
	as chairman of the Compensation Committee. He is a director of the Spanish ACS (Actividades de Construcci&#243;n y Servicios, S.A.) since 2004 and member of the supervisory board of the French Lagard&#232;re SCA since 2008, as well as member of the
	advisory council of Chemo group and senior advisor to the group executive chairman at Banco Santander, both since June 2015. Prior to that, Mr. Monz&#243;n was Chairman and CEO of Indra Sistemas, S.A. from 1992 until 2015. He was a Partner at Arthur
	Andersen from 1989-1990. He also served as Chief Financial Officer of Telefonica, S.A. from 1984-1987, after which he acted as Executive Vice President until 1989. Mr. Monz&#243;n began his career at Caja Madrid, where he was a Corporate Banking
	Director. Mr. Monz&#243;n served as vice chairman of the American Chamber of Commerce in Spain from March 2010 until January 2015 and is member of the international advisory council of Brookings since 2014. He holds a Degree in Economics from
	Universidad Complutense de Madrid.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	62
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage65"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Juan Villar-Mir de Fuentes
</B>
	has served as a director since
	December&nbsp;23, 2015. He has acted as the Vice Chairman of Grupo Villar Mir, S.A.U. since 1999. He is also Vice Chairman and CEO of Inmobiliaria Espacio, S.A. Mr.&nbsp;Villar-Mir de Fuentes has served on the board of directors of Obrasc&oacute;n
	Huarte Lain, S.A. since 1996 and the board of directors of Abertis Infraestructuras, S.A. since 2012. He also serves as a director and on the audit committee of Inmobiliaria Colonial, S.A. He holds a Bachelor&#146;s Degree in Business Administration
	and Economics and Business Management.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	B.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<B>
	Compensation.
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<I>
	Compensation of Executive Officers and Directors
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	From our inception on February&nbsp;5, 2015 up through the closing of the Business Combination, we were a shell entity and did
	not conduct any activities other than those incidental to our formation, the execution and performance of the Business Combination Agreement, such as the formation of Globe Merger Sub, the Business Combination, the filings required to be made under
	applicable laws, including U.S. securities laws, the laws of the State of Delaware, the laws of England and Wales, and antitrust and competition laws in connection with the Business Combination, and the preparation of a proxy statement/prospectus on
	Form F-4, which was declared effective by the SEC on August&nbsp;11, 2015. During this period, we did not compensate our directors and executive officers.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Our Predecessor, FerroAtl&aacute;ntica, was a private Spanish company, and as such is not required to publicly disclose the
	compensation of its directors and executive officers under its home country laws. Accordingly, we have not included any information about our Predecessor&#146;s compensation of its directors and executive officers for the fiscal year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	C.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<B>
	Board practices.
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Board Composition and Election of Directors
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Our Board of Directors consists of nine directors with four directors designated by Globe and five directors designated by
	Grupo VM. Alan Kestenbaum, is the Executive Chairman of the Board and is one of the Globe designees. Javier L&oacute;pez Madrid is Executive Vice-Chairman of the Board and a Grupo VM designee. At least two of the Grupo VM designees and three of the
	Globe designees are required to qualify as &#147;independent directors&#148;, as such term is defined in the NASDAQ stock market rules and applicable law.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Pursuant to the Articles, our directors are elected to a term concluding at the first annual general meeting of shareholders
	after the consummation of the Business Combination and thereafter for one year terms.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Director
	Independence
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Pursuant to the Articles, each director of the Company shall at all times (A)&nbsp;be qualified to
	serve as a director under applicable rules and policies of the Company, the NASDAQ and applicable law and (B)&nbsp;have demonstrated good judgment, character and integrity in his or her personal and professional dealings and have relevant financial,
	management and/or global business experience.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Pursuant to the Shareholder Agreement between Grupo VM and us entered into
	on December&nbsp;23, 2015, the qualification of each of the director nominees who are required to qualify as &#147;independent&#148; under the NASDAQ shall be determined by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, acting reasonably and in
	good faith and in a manner consistent with the fiduciary duties of each director and the rules of the NASDAQ and applicable law.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In connection with the director appointments to the Board upon the closing of the Business Combination, our previous Board
	passed a Directors&#146; Written Resolution by unanimous written consent, dated as of December&nbsp;23, 2015, which, among other things, appointed our current directors to the Board upon the consummation of the Business Combination. During this
	meeting, the Board undertook a review of director independence by reviewing meeting declarations of interests held by each of Messrs. Kestenbaum, L&oacute;pez Madrid, Barger, Crockett, Eizenstat, Garc&iacute;a Madrid, Hamilton, Monz&oacute;n and
	Villar-Mir de Fuentes, which had been provided to the other directors of the Company in accordance with the requirements of section 184 of the Companies Act 2006. This review is designed to identify and evaluate any transactions or relationships
	between a director or any member of his immediate family and us or members of our senior management. Based on this review, our board of directors has affirmatively determined that each of Messrs. Barger, Crockett, Eizenstat, Hamilton and
	Monz&oacute;n meet the independence requirements of the NASDAQ rules.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	63
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage66"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Committees of the Board of Directors
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Our board of directors has three standing committees: an Audit Committee, a Compensation Committee, and a Nominating and
	Corporate Governance Committee. In addition, pursuant to the Business Combination Agreement, the Board created a &#147;BCA&#148; Special Committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Audit Committee
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Our Audit Committee consists of three directors: Messrs. Crockett, Hamilton and Monz&oacute;n, and Mr.&nbsp;Hamilton serves as
	its chairman and meets the requirements as an &#147;audit committee financial expert&#148; under the rules of the SEC and qualifies as a financially sophisticated audit committee member as required by the NASDAQ rules relating to audit committees.
	Our Board has determined that each of these directors satisfies the enhanced independence requirements for audit committee members required by Rule 10A-3 under the Exchange Act, and is financially literate as that phrase is used in the additional
	audit committee requirements of the NASDAQ rules.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Our Audit Committee has responsibility to: (1)&nbsp;oversee our
	accounting and financial reporting processes and the audits of our financial statements; (2)&nbsp;monitor and make recommendations to the Board regarding the auditing and integrity of our consolidated financial statements; (3)&nbsp;be directly
	responsible for the qualification, selection, retention, independence, performance and compensation of our independent auditors, including resolution of disagreements between management and the auditors regarding financial reporting, for the purpose
	of preparing or issuing an audit report or performing other audit, review or attest services for us, and have the auditors report directly to the Committee; and (4)&nbsp;provide oversight in respect of our internal audit and accounting and financial
	reporting processes. The Audit Committee will meet at least four times a year. Additional meetings may occur as the Audit Committee or its chair deem advisable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Compensation Committee
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Our Compensation Committee consists of three directors: Messrs. Barger, Hamilton and Monz&oacute;n, and Mr.&nbsp;Monz&oacute;n
	serves as its chairman. Our Board has determined that each of these directors meets the heightened independence requirements of compensation committee members under SEC rules.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Our Compensation Committee has responsibility to: (1)&nbsp;evaluate and approve the compensation of our directors, executive
	officers and key employees; (2)&nbsp;oversee directly or indirectly all compensation programs involving the use of our stock; (3)&nbsp;produce a report annually on executive compensation for inclusion in our proxy statement for our annual meeting of
	shareholders; (4)&nbsp;produce a report annually in compliance with remuneration reporting requirements (i.e., a directors&#146; remuneration report), in each case in accordance with applicable rules and regulations; and (5)&nbsp;produce, review on
	an ongoing basis and update as needed, a directors&#146; remuneration policy. The Compensation Committee will meet with such frequency, and at such times, and places and whether in person or electronically/telephonically as it determines is
	necessary to carry out its duties and responsibilities, but shall meet at least two times annually.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Nominating and Corporate
	Governance Committee
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Our nominating and corporate governance committee (the &#147;N&amp;CG Committee&#148;)
	consists of three directors: Messrs. Barger, Eizenstat and Garc&iacute;a Madrid, and Mr.&nbsp;Barger serves as its chairman.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Our N&amp;CG Committee has responsibility to consider and make recommendations to the Board related to Board membership and
	governance. The responsibility of our N&amp;CG Committee as set forth in its Charter include the following: identifying and recommending to the Board for nomination individuals qualified to become Board members; reviewing and providing guidance on
	the independence of nominees; reviewing and providing guidance on the organization of the Board and its committee structure; reviewing and providing guidance on the self-evaluation procedures of the Board and its committees; reviewing and providing
	guidance on our code of ethics; reviewing and providing guidance on our stock ownership guidelines; and reviewing and providing guidance on proposed changes to the Articles. The N&amp;CG Committee will meet at least once a year. Additional meetings
	may occur as the N&amp;CG Committee or its chairperson deem advisable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	BCA Special Committee
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Our BCA Special Committee (the &#147;BCA Committee&#148;) consists of three directors: Messrs. Crockett, Eizenstat and
	Hamilton. The BCA Committee was formed in connection with the business combination transaction and has responsibility to: (1)&nbsp;administer the post-closing adjustment process and procedures, for us and on our behalf, pursuant to Section&nbsp;1.3
	of the Business Combination Agreement (which relates to the FerroAtl&aacute;ntica &#147;net debt&#148; adjustment provision in the Business Combination Agreement); (2)&nbsp;evaluate potential claims for losses and enforce the indemnification rights
	under the Business Combination Agreement; (3)&nbsp;exercise or waive any of our rights, benefits or remedies under the Business Combination Agreement; and (4)&nbsp;evaluate potential claims under our Buyer-side Representations and Warranties
	Insurance Policy.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	64
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage67"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Code of Business Conduct and Ethics
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	We have adopted a code of ethics that applies to all of our directors, officers and other employees of the Company and its
	subsidiaries. The code includes additional policies applicable to the Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer and Senior Financial Officers as required by NASDAQ rules and Section&nbsp;406 of the Sarbanes Oxley Act of 2002.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Board Policy
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	We have adopted a Board Policy which provides certain practical principles relating to (i)&nbsp;the functioning of the Board;
	and (ii)&nbsp;the principles under which we will undertake our core management and overall supervision tasks from our London headquarters (the &#147;Board Policy&#148;). Following the Business Combination, and as set out in the Board Policy, we
	intend to provide management and other services (including, but not limited to, administration, financial, commercial and technical services) to Globe, FerroAtl&aacute;ntica and any other subsidiaries from time to time.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	D.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<B>
	Employees.
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, on a consolidated basis, the number of employees was 4,543, 3,162 and 3,185,
	respectively, excluding temporary employees. The increase in employees from 2014 to 2015 is a result of the business combination with Globe. We believe our relations with our employees are good and we have not experienced any significant labor
	disputes or work stoppages.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The following tables show the number of our full-time employees as of December&nbsp;31,
	2015, 2014 and 2013 on a consolidated basis broken down based on business segment and geographical location:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	A majority of employees are affiliated with labor unions and have entered into collective
	bargaining agreements in Spain, France, South Africa, United States and Venezuela. We have experienced union activity and strikes in the past. In 2014, there was a strike at FerroAtl&aacute;ntica&#146;s South African subsidiary that reduced
	production for seven days. FerroAtl&aacute;ntica has also experienced strikes by its employees in France from time to time. Several of FerroAtl&aacute;ntica Group&#146;s collective bargaining agreements expire before the end of 2015 and one, with
	respect to FerroAtl&aacute;ntica Group&#146;s subsidiary Silicio Ferrosolar S.L.U., expired at the end of 2014, though it remains applicable until a new agreement is negotiated and enters into force. See &#147;Risk Factors&#151;We are subject to the
	risk of union disputes and work stoppages at our facilities, which could have a material adverse effect on our business&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Employees at Cee, Boo, Hidronitro, Sab&oacute;n and Madrid work under a collective bargaining agreement that expired on
	December&nbsp;31, 2015. A new agreement is under negotiation. During the negotiations the expired agreement remains effective. The collective bargaining agreement for Silicio Ferrosolar will expire on December&nbsp;31, 2017.
	FerroAtl&aacute;ntica&#146;s research and development employees at December&nbsp;31, 2015 have no collective bargaining agreement, but adhere to the terms of the Sab&oacute;n&#146;s collective agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	65
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage68"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In Mangshi, China, our workers are unionized but there is no formal collective
	bargaining agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Mine employees in Spain also work under union contracts. The contracts applicable to the employees
	at Cuarzos Industriales expired on December&nbsp;31, 2015. A new agreement is under negotiation. The agreement applicable to our employees at Ramsa one will expire on December&nbsp;31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	All employees at FerroPem plants at Anglefort, Chateau-Feuillet, Les Clavaux, Laudun, Montricher, and Pierrefitte and the
	Chamb&eacute;ry offices are covered by the national Collective Chemistry Agreement has no expiration date. We engage in annual discussion regarding salary and bargain over profit sharing every three years. The next round of bargaining occurs in June
	2016 and a second round follows in December 2017.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Hourly employees at Polokwane work under a contract that will expire
	in July, 2016 and negotiations of a new contract have begun. Hourly employees at Emalahleni work under contracts that will expire in 2017.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Hourly employees at the Selma, Alabama facility are covered by a collective bargaining agreement with the Industrial Division
	of the Communications Workers of America, under a contract running through April&nbsp;2, 2017. Hourly employees at the Alloy, West Virginia, Niagara Falls, New York and Bridgeport, Alabama facilities are covered by collective bargaining agreements
	with The United Steel, Paper and Forestry, Rubber, Manufacturing, Energy, Allied Industrial and Service Workers International Union under contracts running through April&nbsp;27, 2017,&nbsp;July&nbsp;30, 2017, and March&nbsp;3, 2018, respectively.
	Union employees in Argentina are working under a contract running through April&nbsp;30, 2016. Operations in Poland and Yonvey, China are not unionized. Union employees in Canada work at the Becancour, Qu&eacute;bec, plant and are covered by a Union
	Certification held by CEP, Local 184. The corresponding collective bargaining agreement at its Becancour facility runs through April&nbsp;30, 2017.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	E.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<B>
	Share ownership.
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following table and accompanying footnotes show information regarding the beneficial ownership of our Shares by:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	each named executive officer;

	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The percentage of Shares beneficially owned is based on 171,838,153 Shares issued and outstanding on April&nbsp;22, 2016.
	Beneficial ownership for the purposes of this table is determined in accordance with the rules and regulations of the SEC. These rules generally provide that a person is the beneficial owner of securities if such person has or shares the power to
	vote or direct the voting thereof, or to dispose or direct the disposition thereof or has the right to acquire such powers within 60 days.

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">

	Less than one percent (1%).
</P>
</TD>
</TR>

	Each Class&nbsp;A Ordinary Share held by Grupo VM and its affiliates was converted into one (1)&nbsp;Ordinary
	Share for purposes of calculating the beneficial ownership percentage.
</P>

	Includes 36,828 shares issuable upon exercise of options within 60 days of April&nbsp;22, 2016.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<EFX_SECURITY_OWNERS>
<A NAME="FIS_SECURITY_OWNERS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<A NAME="D158678D20F_HTM_TX158678_10">
</A>
	Item&nbsp;7. MAJOR SHAREHOLDERS AND RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	A.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<B>
	Major Shareholders.
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The following table sets forth certain information regarding beneficial ownership of Shares as of March&nbsp;9, 2016 by each
	stockholder known by us to be the beneficial owner of more than 5% of the Shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Beneficial ownership is determined in
	accordance with the rules of the SEC and includes voting or investment power with respect to the securities. Shares of Stock that may be acquired by an individual or group within 60 days of March&nbsp;9, 2016, pursuant to the exercise of options,
	are deemed to be outstanding for the purpose of computing the percentage ownership of such individual or group, but are not deemed to be outstanding for the purpose of computing the percentage ownership of any other person shown in the table.
	Percentage of ownership is based on 171,838,153 Shares outstanding on April&nbsp;22, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	purposes of calculating the beneficial ownership percentage.

</TD>

</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Includes 500,000 vested options and 108,578 unvested restricted shares.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	On December&nbsp;23, 2015, in connection with the closing of the Business Combination Grupo VM agreed to pledge depositary
	receipts representing rights in respect of 98,078,161 of our Class&nbsp;A Ordinary Shares beneficially owned by Grupo VM, an amount equal to approximately 57% of our issued and outstanding Shares, to secure the outstanding Loan. In the event Grupo
	VM defaults under the Credit Agreement, the Security Agent may foreclose on the depositary receipts subject to the pledge. In such case, we could experience a change of control.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Grupo VM is seeking permission from the Lenders to release the depositary receipts representing rights in respect of
	17,183,815 of our Class&nbsp;A Ordinary Shares as security under the Pledge Agreement. Grupo VM is not currently seeking permission from the Lenders to release the remaining depositary receipts in respect of the Class&nbsp;A Ordinary Shares
	beneficially owned by Grupo VM as security under the Pledge Agreement. Before any Ordinary Shares registered that relate to the depositary receipts in respect of Class&nbsp;A Ordinary Shares beneficially owned by Grupo VM may be sold, Grupo VM will
	be required to obtain a release of such depositary receipts as security under the Pledge Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Company&#146;s
	shareholders do not have different voting rights.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of April&nbsp;22, 2016, Ferroglobe had 2 record holders in the
	United States, holding approximately 99.99% of our outstanding Shares, of which 98,078,161 of such shares are held by a depositary nominee on behalf of Grupo VM.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	B.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<B>
	Related Party Transactions.
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The following includes a summary of transactions since (x)&nbsp;February&nbsp;5, 2015, when we were formed, to which we have
	been a party, (y)&nbsp;June&nbsp;30, 2013 to which Globe has been a party and (z)&nbsp;January&nbsp;1, 2013 to which FerroAtl&aacute;ntica has been a party, with any: (i)&nbsp;enterprises that directly or indirectly through one or more
	intermediaries, control or are controlled by, or are under
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	67
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage70"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	common control with, us, Globe or FerroAtl&aacute;ntica, as applicable, (ii)&nbsp;associates, (iii)&nbsp;individuals owning, directly or indirectly, an interest in the voting power of the
	Company, Globe, or FerroAtl&aacute;ntica, as applicable, that gives them significant influence over us, Globe or FerroAtl&aacute;ntica, as applicable, and close members of any such individual&#146;s family, (iv)&nbsp;key management personnel,
	including directors and senior management of companies and close members of such individuals&#146; families or (v)&nbsp;enterprises in which a substantial interest in the voting power is owned, directly or indirectly, by any person described in
	(iii)&nbsp;or (iv)&nbsp;or over which such person is able to exercise significant influence.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Grupo VM Shareholder Agreement
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	On December&nbsp;23, 2015, we entered into a shareholder agreement with Grupo VM (the &#147;Grupo VM Shareholder
	Agreement&#148;) that contained various rights and obligations with respect to Grupo VM&#146;s Class&nbsp;A Ordinary Shares. Under the Grupo VM Shareholder Agreement, Grupo VM has the right to nominate the number of directors for the Board that is
	proportionate to its share ownership and to designate one of the Grupo VM director designees to serve as Executive Vice-Chairman of the Board. On December&nbsp;23, 2015, Grupo VM designated Javier L&oacute;pez Madrid to serve as the Executive
	Vice-Chairman of the Board in connection with the closing of the Business Combination. The Grupo VM Shareholder Agreement also provides that Grupo VM director designees will be proportionately represented on each committee of the Board, subject to
	the NASDAQ stock market rules, except that the Globe independent directors will constitute a majority of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee and the BCA Special Committee will be composed of two Globe independent directors and one
	independent Grupo VM director.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Until the date on which Grupo VM no longer has the right to designate or nominate a
	majority of the Board and Grupo VM directors no longer constitute the majority of the Board (the &#147;Decrease Date&#148;), the independent directors designated to the Board by Globe (or replacements designated thereby) will have the exclusive
	right to nominate persons for election at any shareholders meeting called for the purpose of electing directors, subject to the right of Grupo VM to designate and nominate directors as provided under the Grupo VM Shareholder Agreement. On and after
	the Decrease Date, the Board will have the right to nominate persons for election at any shareholders meeting called for the purpose of electing directors, subject to the right of Grupo VM to designate and nominate directors as provided under the
	Grupo VM Shareholder Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Under the Grupo VM Shareholder Agreement, other than with respect to the election of
	directors (other than the Grupo VM director nominees) in a contested election for directors that occurs from and after the fifth anniversary of the closing of the Business Combination, Grupo VM shall vote its Shares to cause the election or
	reelection, as applicable, of the Grupo VM director nominees and the other persons nominated by the Board for election of directors. Grupo VM shall also not vote its Shares to cause the removal of the Globe independent directors or
	Mr.&nbsp;Kestenbaum or any replacement of Mr.&nbsp;Kestenbaum. In the case of a contested election for directors that occurs from and after the fifth anniversary of the closing of the Business Combination, Grupo VM will agree to abstain from voting
	its Shares with respect to the election of directors (other than the Grupo VM director nominees and Mr.&nbsp;Kestenbaum or any replacement Mr.&nbsp;Alan Kestenbaum).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Subject to certain exceptions, Grupo VM has preemptive rights to subscribe for up to its proportionate share of any Shares
	issued in connection with any primary offerings. The Grupo VM Shareholder Agreement (i)&nbsp;also restricts the ability of Grupo VM and its affiliates to acquire additional Shares and (ii)&nbsp;contains a standstill provision that limits certain
	proposals and other actions that can be taken by Grupo VM or its affiliates with respect to the Company, in each case, subject to certain exceptions, including prior Board approval. The Grupo VM Shareholder Agreement also restricts the manner by
	which, and persons to whom, Grupo VM or its affiliates may transfer Shares. On February&nbsp;3, 2016, during an in-person meeting of our Board, the Board approved the purchase of up to one percent (1%)&nbsp;of the Shares by Javier L&oacute;pez
	Madrid in the open market pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.01(b)(vi) of the Grupo VM Shareholder Agreement (&#147;JLM Shares&#148;). In connection with the foregoing, Grupo VM and the Company, entered into Amendment NO. 1 to the Grupo VM Shareholder
	Agreement, dated as of February&nbsp;10, 2016, which amended the Grupo VM Shareholder Agreement to disregard the JLM Shares from determining the percentage of the total aggregate issued and outstanding Shares of the Company owned by Grupo VM and its
	affiliates.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Grupo VM Shareholder Agreement will terminate on the first date on which Grupo VM and its affiliates
	hold less than 15% of the outstanding Shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	AK Shareholder Agreement
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	On December&nbsp;23, 2015, we entered into a separate shareholder agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Kestenbaum and certain of his
	affiliates (the &#147;AK Shareholder Agreement&#148;) that contained various rights and obligations with respect to their Ordinary Shares. Pursuant to the AK Shareholder Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Kestenbaum was appointed as Executive Chairman of the Board
	on December&nbsp;23, 2015 in connection with the closing of the Business Combination, and, so long as he is serving in such capacity, he will be entitled to be nominated for election as a director at any meeting of our shareholders called for the
	purpose of electing directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	68
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage71"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Under the AK Shareholder Agreement, except with respect to a contested election
	for directors (other than Grupo VM director nominees), that occurs after the fifth anniversary of the closing of the Business Combination, so long as Mr.&nbsp;Kestenbaum and his affiliates own at least 1% of the total issued and outstanding Shares,
	Mr.&nbsp;Kestenbaum and his affiliates will vote their Ordinary Shares to cause the election or reelection, as applicable, of the Grupo VM director nominees and the other persons nominated by the Board for election of directors. In the case of a
	contested election for directors that occurs from and after the fifth anniversary of the closing of the Business Combination, Mr.&nbsp;Kestenbaum and his affiliates may vote their shares with respect to the election of directors (other than the
	Grupo VM director nominees) in any manner with respect to such contested election for directors. Mr.&nbsp;Kestenbaum and his affiliates must always vote in favor of the Grupo VM director nominees.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The AK Shareholder Agreement also provides that Mr.&nbsp;Kestenbaum will enter into a &#147;gain recognition agreement&#148;
	with the IRS if he is treated as a &#147;five-percent transferee shareholder&#148; of the Company following the Globe Merger, and will enter into subsequent &#147;gain recognition agreements&#148; with respect to actions or transactions taken by the
	Company or its affiliates, as required under applicable law.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The AK Shareholder Agreement will terminate upon the later
	of (i)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Kestenbaum no longer acting as Executive Chairman of the Company or (ii)&nbsp;the aggregate total issued and outstanding Shares owned by Mr.&nbsp;Kestenbaum and his affiliates falling below 1%; provided that the tax covenants
	and indemnification obligation will survive until such time as set forth in the AK Shareholder Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Registration Rights
	Agreement
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	On December&nbsp;23, 2015, we entered into a registration rights agreement with Grupo VM and
	Mr.&nbsp;Kestenbaum pursuant to which we will grant certain registration rights to each of Grupo VM and Mr.&nbsp;Kestenbaum.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Agreements with Executive Officers and Key Employees
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	We have entered into agreements with our executive officers and key employees. See &#147;Directors, Senior Management and
	Employees.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

<I>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Alan Kestenbaum, a current member of the board of directors is affiliated with Marco International.

	the purchase of carbon electrodes. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, payables to Marco International under these
	agreements totaled $1,678,000.

	the sale of ferrosilicon to Marco International. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, receivables from Marco
	International under these agreements totaled $132,000.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	VM Energ&iacute;a
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	VM Energ&iacute;a, a Spanish company wholly owned by Grupo VM, advises in the day-to-day operations of FerroAtl&aacute;ntica
	Group&#146;s hydroelectric plants under two contracts entered into in April 2013 that provide for strategic advisory services to be provided by VM Energ&iacute;a to FerroAtl&aacute;ntica and Hidro Nitro Espa&ntilde;ola. VM Energ&iacute;a&#146;s
	services under these contracts include the provisions of advisory services in relation to any economic, technical and administrative aspect of FerroAtl&aacute;ntica Group&#146;s energy operations, the preparation of periodic reports assessing the
	main risks associated with the energy market and analyzing the performance of each hydroelectric power plant, the provision of advisory services in connection with changes in the applicable energy regulatory framework and related assistance in
	dealing with the competent energy authorities. The contracts have five-year terms and are due to expire in 2018. FerroAtl&aacute;ntica and Hidro Nitro Espa&ntilde;ola pay VM Energ&iacute;a a monthly remuneration calculated as a percentage of the
	revenues made each month by FerroAtl&aacute;ntica Group&#146;s hydroelectric power plants. For the fiscal years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, FerroAtl&aacute;ntica and Hidro Nitro Espa&ntilde;ola made payments under these contracts to
	VM Energ&iacute;a of $4,022,346, $7,055,663 and $11,851,964, respectively. VM Energ&iacute;a is not legally deemed to be a direct or indirect operator of the hydroelectric power plants owned by FerroAtl&aacute;ntica Group in spite of the services
	provided to FerroAtl&aacute;ntica Group under the strategic advisory services agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Under contracts entered into
	with FerroAtl&aacute;ntica on June&nbsp;22, 2010 and December&nbsp;29, 2010, and with Hidro Nitro Espa&ntilde;ola, S.A. on June&nbsp;22, 2010 and December&nbsp;29, 2010, and with Hidro Nitro Espa&ntilde;ola on December&nbsp;27, 2012, VM
	Energ&iacute;a supplies the energy needs of the Boo, Sabon and Monz&oacute;n electrometallurgy facilities, as a broker for FerroAtl&aacute;ntica and Hidro Nitro Espa&ntilde;ola in the wholesale power market. The contracts allow FerroAtl&aacute;ntica
	and Hidro Nitro Espa&ntilde;ola to buy energy from the grid at market conditions without incurring costs normally associated with operating in the complex wholesale power market, as well as to apply for fixed energy price arrangements in advance
	from VM Energ&iacute;a, based on the energy markets for the power, period and profile applied for. The contracts have a term of one
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	69
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage72"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	year, which can be extended by the mutual consent of the parties to the contract, and will expire on December&nbsp;31, 2015, unless it is extended. FerroAtl&aacute;ntica pays VM Energ&iacute;a a
	service charge in addition to paying for the cost of energy purchase from the market. For the fiscal years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, FerroAtl&aacute;ntica and Hidro Nitro Espa&ntilde;ola made payments under these contracts to VM
	Energ&iacute;a of $85,509,925, $87,032,692 and &#128;86,413,826, respectively. These contracts are similar to contracts FerroAtl&aacute;ntica signs with other third-party brokers. Additionally, for the fiscal years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014
	and 2013, VM Energ&iacute;a invoiced other subsidiaries of FerroAtl&aacute;ntica Group for a total amount of $587,289, $738,645 and $703,210, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Under contracts dated June&nbsp;30, 2012, En&eacute;rgya VM Generaci&oacute;n, S.L. (&#147;En&eacute;rgya VM&#148;), a Spanish
	company wholly owned by VM Energ&iacute;a, arranges for the sale of energy produced by FerroAtl&aacute;ntica and Hidro Nitro Espa&ntilde;ola&#146;s hydroelectric plants. Pursuant to the contracts, En&eacute;rgya VM provides energy market brokerage
	services and represents the FerroAtl&aacute;ntica Group subsidiaries before the applicable energy market operator, the system operator and the Spanish National Markets and Competition Commission. FerroAtl&aacute;ntica and Hidro Nitro Espa&ntilde;ola
	pay En&eacute;rgya VM a monthly remuneration calculated as a percentage of the sales made each month by their hydroelectric power plants. These contracts currently have one-year terms, subject to automatic yearly renewal, unless terminated with
	notice provided one month prior to the scheduled renewal. For the fiscal years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, Hidro Nitro Espa&ntilde;ola made payments under its contract to En&eacute;rgya VM of $166,851, $666,907 and $1,969,572,
	respectively, and FerroAtl&aacute;ntica made payments under its contracts to En&eacute;rgya VM of $474,161, $1,234,176 and $1,667,000, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	On January&nbsp;28, 2016, FerroAtl&aacute;ntica entered into a swap contract with Energya VM, a wholly owned subsidiary of VM
	Energ&iacute;a, of 75 megawatts of energy at 43.1 &#128;/MWh for each of the second, third and fourth quarters of 2016. Together with another swap contract that FerroAtl&aacute;ntica entered into with a third party in November 2015 for 25 megawatts,
	we have locked in energy prices for approximately 35-40% of our total needs for 2016. The average price of the two energy contracts represents a savings of 2.5&nbsp;million Euros compared with the budgeted price. We expect to make payments to
	En&eacute;rgya VM in 2016 of approximately Euros 21,000,000.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Espacio Information Technology, S.A.
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Espacio Information Technology, S.A. (&#147;Espacio I.T.&#148;), a Spanish company wholly owned by Grupo VM, provides
	information technology and data processing services to three FerroAtl&aacute;ntica Group subsidiaries: FerroAtl&aacute;ntica, FerroAtl&aacute;ntica de Mexico, and Silicon Smelters pursuant to several contracts.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Under a contract entered into on January&nbsp;1, 2004 Espacio I.T. provides FerroAtl&aacute;ntica with information
	processing, data management, data security, communications, systems control and customer support services. The contract has a one-year term, subject to automatic yearly renewal, unless terminated with notice provided three months prior to the
	scheduled renewal. The base yearly amount due under the contract for these services is $519,788, exclusive of VAT and subject to inflation adjustment. For the fiscal years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, FerroAtl&aacute;ntica made
	payments under this contract to Espacio I.T. of 939,464, $1,235,505 and $1,342,709, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Under a contract
	entered into on January&nbsp;1, 2006, Espacio I.T. provides FerroPem, S.A.S. with information processing, data management, data security, communications, systems control and customer support services. The contract has a one-year term, subject to
	automatic yearly renewal, unless terminated with notice provided three months prior to the scheduled renewal. The base yearly amount due under the contract for these services is $762,094, exclusive of VAT and subject to inflation adjustment. For the
	fiscal years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, FerroPem made payments under this contract to Espacio I.T. of $861,133, $1,146,495 and $913,733, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Under a contract entered into on June&nbsp;26, 2014, Espacio I.T. provides FerroAtl&aacute;ntica de Mexico with information
	processing, data management, data security, communications, systems control and customer support services. The contract has a two year term, subject to automatic renewal every two years, unless terminated with notice six months prior to the
	scheduled renewal. The base yearly amount due under the contract for these services is $21,920, exclusive of VAT and subject to inflation adjustment and adjustment based on the level of production of the previous year. From the date of effectiveness
	of the contract in July 2014 through December&nbsp;31, 2014, FerroAtl&aacute;ntica de Mexico made payments to Espacio I.T. of $5,480. In 2015 FerroAtl&aacute;ntica Mexico made payments to EIT for $18,313.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Under a contract entered into on January&nbsp;1, 2009, Espacio I.T. provides Silicon Smelters with services including the
	maintenance and monitoring of the company&#146;s network, servers, applications, and user workstations, as well as standard software licenses. The contract has a one-year term, subject to automatic yearly renewal, unless terminated with notice three
	months prior to the scheduled renewal. The base yearly amount due under the contact is $265,700, subject to inflation adjustment. For the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, Silicon Smelters made payments under this contract
	to Espacio I.T. of $243,572, $299,533 and $290,608, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	For the fiscal years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015,
	2014 and 2013, Espacio I.T. invoiced other subsidiaries of FerroAtl&aacute;ntica in a total amount of $780,353, $240,987 and $402,950, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In April 2016, the Ferroglobe Board approved a proposal to obtain certain
	information technology services from Espacio I.T., and the parties are currently negotiating a contract for the provision of these services. The contract is anticipated to have a minimum of 5 years term, to require an initial investment of $1.7
	million during 2016 and an annual base payment of $360,000. These investments and services are required to consolidate the IT infrastructure and information systems of Globe and FerroAtl&aacute;ntica. Additional services may be required in 2017 to
	achieve full convergence of IT systems.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Aurinka Solar
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Javier L&oacute;pez Madrid, a current member of the Board is affiliated with Aurinka Solar. During the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, FerroAtl&aacute;ntica:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Entered into an agreement with Aurinka Solar for project optimization and
	characterization of silicon UMG purification process which provided state-level technology regarding conversion costs and quality of the final product ahead of undertaking industrial development. Purchases under this agreement totaled Euro 690,000.
	This project ended in 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Entered into a project with Aurinka Solar for the production of solar silicon following the
	SIEMENS chemical process and other recycled, and detailed parameters of the process and its outcome through which Aurinka Photovoltaic Group determined which of the various technologies applied to SIEMENS process best suited Silicon production by
	the Company. Purchases under this project totaled Euro 445,000. This project ended in 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In 2016,
	FerroAtl&aacute;ntica entered into a project with Aurinka Solar for a feasibility study and basic engineering for a manufacturing silicon solar grade UMG plant. Purchases under this project is expected to be approximately Euro 1,200,000 for 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

	Headquarters Lease
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Under lease agreements entered into on August&nbsp;9, 2007 and April&nbsp;2, 2012 Torre Espacio Castellana, S.A., a Spanish
	company wholly owned by Grupo VM, leases to FerroAtl&aacute;ntica floor 49 and floor 45 South of the Torre Espacio office building in Paseo de la Castellana, Madrid, along with a number of parking spaces. As of November&nbsp;30, 2013, these
	agreements had a 10-year term, which will expire on November&nbsp;30, 2023. The base amount of annual rent is $786,546 for floor 49 and the parking spaces and $368,534 for floor 45 South, in each case subject to annual variation according to
	inflation. For the fiscal years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013, FerroAtl&aacute;ntica made payments under these contracts to Torre Espacio Castellana of $1,511,000 and $1,507,000, respectively. On November&nbsp;23, 2015 this company ceased to
	be related party of Grupo VM. In this sense, the rent from 1
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	st
</SUP>
	of January to November of 2015 has been $1,138,064.
