<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Venezuela
</B>
</P>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Benefit Plan
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The company FerroVen has pension obligations to all of its employees who, once reaching retirement age, have accumulated at
	least 15 years of service to the company and receive a Venezuelan Social Security Institute (IVSS) pension. In addition to the pension paid by the IVSS, 80% of the basic salary accrued when the pension benefit is awarded is guaranteed and paid by
	means of a lifelong monthly pension.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The most recent of the present value of the defined benefit obligation actuarial
	valuation was determined at December&nbsp;31, 2015 by independent actuaries. The present value of the obligation for defined benefit cost, the current service cost and past service cost were determined using the projected unit credit method.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In this regards, the changes of this provision in 2015 and 2014 were as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	North America
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	a.&nbsp;Defined Benefit Retirement and Postretirement Plans
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Globe Metallurgical Inc. (GMI) sponsors three non-contributory defined benefit pension plans covering certain employees, which
	were all frozen in 2003. Core Metals sponsors a non-contributory defined benefit pension plan covering certain employees, which was closed to new participants in April 2009.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Quebec Silicon, sponsors a contributory defined benefit pension plan and postretirement benefit plan for certain employees,
	based on length of service and remuneration. Post-retirement benefits consist of a group insurance plan covering plan members for life insurance, disability, hospital, medical, and dental benefits. The contributory defined benefit pension plan was
	closed to new participants in December 2013. On December&nbsp;27, 2013, the Communications, Energy and Paper Workers Union of Canada (&#147;CEP&#148;) ratified a new collective bargaining agreement, which resulted in a curtailment pertaining to the
	closure of the postretirement benefit plan for union employees retiring after January&nbsp;31, 2016. The Company funding policy has been to contribute, as necessary, an amount in excess of the minimum requirements in order to achieve the
	Company&#146;s long-term funding targets.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<I>
	Benefit Obligations and Funded Status
</I>
	&#150; The following provides a
	reconciliation of the benefit obligations, plan assets and funded status of the North American plans as of December&nbsp;31, 2015:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	All North American pension and postretirement plans are underfunded. At December&nbsp;31, 2015
	the accumulated benefit obligation was $58,051 for the defined pension plan and $7,304 for the postretirement plans.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The discount rate used in calculating the present value of our North American pension plan
	obligations is developed based on the Citigroup Pension Discount Curve for both the GMI plans and Core Metals plan, and the Mercer Yield Curve for Quebec Silicon pension and postretirement benefit plans and the expected cash flows of the benefit
	payments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Company expects to make discretionary contributions of approximately $876 to the defined benefit pension and
	postretirement plans for the year ending December&nbsp;31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The following reflects the gross benefit payments that
	are expected to be paid for the benefit plans for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-45
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage143"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The accumulated non-pension postretirement benefit obligation has been determined
	by application of the provisions of the Company&#146;s health care and life insurance plans including established maximums, relevant actuarial assumptions and health care cost trend rates projected at 6.0% for 2016 and decreasing to an ultimate rate
	of 4.3% in fiscal 2033. The effect of a 1% increase in health care cost trend rate on the non-pension postretirement benefit obligation is $1,392. The effect of a 1% decrease in health care cost trend rate on the non-pension postretirement benefit
	obligation is ($1,087).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	b.&nbsp;Other Benefit Plans
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Company administers healthcare benefits for certain retired employees through a separate welfare plan requiring
	reimbursement from the retirees.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Company&#146;s subsidiary, GMI, provides two defined contribution plans
	(401(k)&nbsp;plans) that allow for employee contributions on a pretax basis. The Company agrees to match 25% of participants&#146; contributions up to a maximum of 6% of compensation. Additionally, subsequent to the acquisition of Core Metals, the
	Company began sponsoring the Core Metals defined contribution plan. Under the plan the Company may make discretionary payments to salaried and non-union participants in the form of profit sharing and matching funds.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Other benefit plans offered by the Company include a Section&nbsp;125 cafeteria plan for the pretax payment of healthcare costs
	and flexible spending arrangements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Provisions for third-party liability
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Provisions for third-party liability relate to current legal claims or obligations arising from past actions that involve a
	probable outflow of resources that can be reliably estimated. At the date of preparation of these consolidated financial statements, there were no lawsuits in progress the outcome of which could significantly affect the Company&#146;s equity
	position.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Other provisions
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Other provisions relate to current obligations arising from past actions that involve a probable outflow of resources that can
	be reliably estimated and are not included in the previous sections of this Note to the consolidated financial statements, as &#147;Asset retirement obligations&#148; amounting approximately $12 million (Non-current: $7.3 million and Current: $4.7
	million), &#147;retained contingencies acquisition&#148; amounting approximately $5.7 million (Non-current: $5.2 million and Current: $0.5 million) and other provisions and accruals as of the date of the consolidated financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<U>
	16.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Bank borrowings
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Non-current and current Bank borrowings comprise the following at December&nbsp;31:
</P>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Includes a Revolving Credit Agreement acquired from the Business Combination. On August&nbsp;20, 2013, GSM
	entered into a $300,000 five-year revolving multi-currency credit facility, which includes a $10,000 sublimit for swing line loans and a $25,000 sublimit letter of credit facility. The credit facility refinanced existing debt under the revolving
	multi-currency credit agreement dated May&nbsp;31, 2012 and closing costs. The current credit facility provides up to an additional $198,978 of borrowing capacity as of December&nbsp;31, 2015. At the GSM election, the credit facility may be
	increased by an amount up to $150,000 in the aggregate; such increase may be in the form of term loans or increases in the revolving credit line, subject to lender commitments and certain conditions as described in the credit agreement. The
	agreement contains provisions for adding domestic and foreign subsidiaries of the Company as additional borrowers under the credit facility. The agreement terminates on August&nbsp;20, 2018 and requires no scheduled prepayments before that date.
	Therefore, the Company classifies borrowings under this credit facility as long-term liabilities.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-46
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage144"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Interest on borrowings under the multi-currency credit facility is payable, at
	the Company&#146;s election, at either (a)&nbsp;a base rate (the higher of (i)&nbsp;the U.S. federal funds rate plus 0.50%&nbsp;per annum, (ii)&nbsp;the Administrative Agent&#146;s prime rate or (iii)&nbsp;a Eurocurrency Rate for loans with a one
	month interest period plus 1.00%&nbsp;per annum plus a margin ranging from 0.50% to 1.50%&nbsp;per annum (such margin determined by reference to the leverage ratio set forth in the credit agreement), or (b)&nbsp;the Eurocurrency Rate plus a margin
	ranging from 1.50% to 2.50%&nbsp;per annum (such margin determined by reference to the leverage ratio set forth in the credit agreement). Certain commitment fees are also payable under the credit agreement. The credit agreement contains various
	covenants. They include, among others, a maximum net debt to earnings before income tax, depreciation and amortization ratio and a minimum interest coverage ratio. The credit facility is guaranteed by certain of the Company&#146;s domestic
	subsidiaries (the &#147;Guarantors&#148;). Borrowings under the credit agreement are collateralized by the assets of the Company and the Guarantors, including certain real property, equipment, accounts receivable, inventory and the stock of certain
	of the Company&#146;s and the Guarantors&#146; subsidiaries. The Company was in compliance with its financial loan covenants at December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2015, there was a $100,000 balance outstanding on the revolving multi-currency credit facility.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The average interest rate on the Company&#146;s financial borrowings during 2015, until the
	date of the Business Combination Globe, was 5.44%. The average interest rate on the Company&#146;s financial borrowings during 2014 was 5.07%.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Borrowings to finance investments
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Borrowings to finance investments includes bank borrowings, secured by in real guarantee, arranged to finance investments in
	non-current assets, including most following at December&nbsp;31:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>

</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Main bank borrowings agreements include conditions relating to the achievement of certain
	financial and equity ratios associated with the separate financial statements of each company that is a party thereto.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	With regard to the syndicated loan (1), on November&nbsp;29, 2012, the Company refinanced its debt by arranging a loan
	amounting to &#128;34,000 and two syndicated credit facilities. The first syndicated credit facility related to a revolving credit line amounting to &#128;38,000 and the second to an investment credit amounting to &#128;35,000 thousand. At
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, &#128;8,500 and &#128;17,000, respectively, had been drawn down on the loan, without taking into account the expenses inherent to the arrangement thereof. At December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, &#128;10,437 and
	&#128;14,030, respectively, of the credit facility associated with the financing of investments and &#128;38,000 and &#128;18,000, respectively, of the revolving credit facility recognized under &#147;Credit facilities&#148; had been drawn down,
	which are classified as current liabilities. The aforementioned syndicated loan and syndicated credit facility include conditions tied to the achievement of certain economic and equity ratios associated with the subsidiary&#146;s financial
	statements. These ratios had been achieved at the end of 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The loan granted to the subsidiary Silicon Smelters (Pty.)
	Ltd. (2)&nbsp;was refinanced by Standard Bank (South Africa) on February&nbsp;8, 2013 for a maximum amount of ZAR 615 million; this limit relates to a loan for investments amounting to ZAR 315&nbsp;million, a revolving credit facility of ZAR
	250&nbsp;million, also for investments, and a credit facility for a maximum amount of ZAR 50 million. These borrowings mature at five years from the execution of the refinancing, bear interest at a market rate for ZAR loans granted by South African
	banks and are subject to the achievement of certain financial ratios. The original loan granted to this subsidiary, which was still in force at December&nbsp;31, 2015, included conditions relating to the achievement of financial ratios, which had
	been met at year-end.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	With regard to (3), on August&nbsp;1, 2013, the subsidiary FerroPem, S.A.S arranged, for a total of
	&#128;80,000, a loan amounting to &#128;35,000 and two syndicated credit facilities. The first syndicated credit facility related to a revolving credit line amounting to &#128;30,000, reduced in 2015 to &#128;20,000, and the second to the financing
	of the subsidiary&#146;s stock amounting at December&nbsp;31, 2015 to &#128;25,000 (&#128;15,000 in 2014). At December&nbsp;31, 2015, &#128;23,333 had been drawn down (&#128;30,100 in 2014), which were classified as current and non-current items in
	accordance with the maturities established in the repayment schedule, as shown in the foregoing table. At December&nbsp;31, 2014, &#128;14,375 (&#128;14,498 in 2014) of the credit facility associated with the financing of stocks and &#128;19,465
	(&#128;30,000 in 2014) of the revolving credit facility recognized under &#147;Credit facilities&#148; had been drawn down, which are classified as current liabilities. The aforementioned syndicated loan and syndicated credit facility include
	conditions tied to the achievement of certain economic and equity ratios associated with the subsidiary&#146;s financial statements. These ratios had been achieved at the end of 2015. In relation to the revolving credit facility, the subsidiary,
	following law D&#146;Ailly, has provided invoices amounting to &#128;23&nbsp;million (&#128;36 million as of December&nbsp;31, 2014).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The loan to finance investments (4)&nbsp;granted by Compa&ntilde;&iacute;a Espa&ntilde;ola de Financiaci&oacute;n de
	Desarrollo, S.A. (COFIDES) to the subsidiary MangShi Sinice Silicon Industry Company, Ltd., was originally of &#128;25,000&nbsp;thousand, includes conditions relating to the achievement of certain financial ratios associated with the
	subsidiary&#146;s financial statements and also with the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements, that had not been achieved as of year-end. However, a waiver was received from such financial institution prior to year-end.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Lastly, on June&nbsp;30, 2013, the subsidiary Thaba Chueu Mining (Pty.), Ltd. entered into a financing agreement (5)&nbsp;with
	Standard Bank (South Africa), with a limit of ZAR 195&nbsp;million, for the acquisition of the subsidiary SamQuarz (Pty.), Ltd. This loan matures at six years, with the first repayment due 20 months after the agreement execution date. The loan bears
	interest at a market rate for ZAR loans granted by South African banks. This loan includes conditions relating to the achievement of certain financial ratios associated with the subsidiary&#146;s financial statements and also with the Company&#146;s
	consolidated financial statements, that had not been achieved as of year-end. However, a waiver was received from such financial institution prior to year-end.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-49
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage147"></A>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The most significant finance lease relates to the Company&#146;s rights to use certain
	hydroelectrical installations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	This lease expires in 2022, ten years from the date on which it was entered into. Moreover,
	this lease bears interest at a market rate and the Company has entered into hedges (&#147;IRSs&#148;) on the unaccrued interest on this lease (see Note 18).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The minimum lease payments on hydroelectrical installation finance leases at December&nbsp;31 are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<U>
	18. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other financial liabilities
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Interest rate swaps
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Other financial liabilities are solely comprised of interest rate swaps, which hedge the risk of changes in interest rates on
	certain non-current and current obligations. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, the non-current and current portion of other financial liabilities is $7,549 and $0, respectively. At December&nbsp;31, 2014, the non-current and current portion of other
	financial liabilities is $10,467 and $0, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The following interest rate swaps were outstanding at
	December&nbsp;31:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Foreign currency swaps (forwards)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Company has arranged forward foreign currency purchase and sale transactions during 2015 with various banks in the amount
	of $18,535, and $28,679 and ZAR 371,973 ($5,298 and $58,163 in 2014). At December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the fair value of these forwards was not significant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

	Estimate of fair value

	Assets and liabilities measured at fair value, based on the hierarchy levels mentioned in Note 4.5, at December&nbsp;31 are as
	follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-52
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage150"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Other liabilities
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Other current liabilities include the $32,500 accrual for a shareholder settlement, as well as $10,000 accrued for Plaintiff
	legal fees as ordered by the Court, in relation to litigation related to the Business Combination. $8,500 of the Plaintiff legal fees are recoverable by insurance and are recorded as a receivable in Other current assets (see Note 12).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Share-Based compensation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	On December&nbsp;23, 2015, Globe Specialty Metals (GSM) completed its business combination with Grupo FerroAtl&aacute;ntica
	under the new combined Company of Ferroglobe. Prior to the business combination, shares of Globe Specialty Metals common stock were registered pursuant to Section&nbsp;12(b) of the Exchange Act and listed on NASDAQ. As a result of the business
	combination (see Note 5), each share of Globe common stock was converted into the right to receive one Ferroglobe ordinary share. The shares of Globe common stock were suspended from trading on NASDAQ effective as of the opening of trading on
	December&nbsp;24, 2015. Ferroglobe ordinary shares were approved for listing on The NASDAQ Global Market. At the effective time of the business combination, GSM stock and stock-based awards were replaced with stock and stock-based awards of
	Ferroglobe in a one to one exchange.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	a. Stock plan
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	There were no options granted or exercised from the date of the business combination through December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	A summary of options outstanding as of December&nbsp;31, 2015:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Company estimates the fair value of stock options using the Black-Scholes option pricing
	model. The following assumptions were used to estimate the fair value of Ferroglobe stock option replacement awards issued on the date of the business combination. No other stock options were granted from the date of the business combination through
	December&nbsp;31, 2015:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_104"></A>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The risk-free interest rate is based on the yield of zero coupon U.S. Treasury bonds with terms
	similar to the expected term of the options. The expected dividend yield is estimated over the expected life of the options based on our historical annual dividend activity. Volatility reflects movements in our stock price over the most recent
	historical period equivalent to the expected life of the options. The expected forfeiture rate is zero as anticipated forfeitures are estimated to be minimal based on historical data. The expected term is the average of the vesting period and
	contractual term.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 there are total vested options of 1,173,414 and 137,252 unvested options
	outstanding.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	From the date of the business combination through December 31, 2015, share-based compensation expense related
	to stock options was $1. The expense is reported within Staff costs in the consolidated income statement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	b. Executive bonus plan
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In addition to share-based awards issued under the 2006 GSM Stock Plan, the Company also issued restricted stock
	units under the Company&#146;s Executive Bonus Plan. The fair value of restricted stock units is based on quoted market prices of the Company&#146;s stock at the end of each reporting period. These restricted stock units proportionally vest over
	three years, but are not delivered until the end of the third year. The Company will settle these awards by cash transfer, based on the Company&#146;s stock price on the date of transfer. From the date of the business combination through December
	31, 2015, no restricted stock units were granted and no restricted options were exercised. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, there were 517,367 restricted stock units were outstanding.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-53
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage151"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	From the date of the business acquisition through December&nbsp;31, 2015,
	share-based compensation expense for these restricted stock units was $39 ($23 after tax). The expense is reported within Staff costs in the consolidated income statement. Of the $2,739 liability associated with these restricted stock units at
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, $57 is included in Other current liabilities and $2,682 is included in Other non-current liabilities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	c.
	Stock appreciation rights
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Company issues cash-settled stock appreciation rights as an additional form of
	incentivized bonus. Stock appreciation rights vest and become exercisable in one-third increments over three years. The Company settles all awards by cash transfer, based on the difference between the Company&#146;s stock price on the date of
	exercise and the date of grant. The Company estimates the fair value of stock appreciation rights using the Black-Scholes option pricing model. From the date of the business combination through December&nbsp;31, 2015, there were no stock
	appreciation rights issued and no stock appreciation rights exercised. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, there were 1,591,489 stock appreciation rights outstanding.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	From the date of the business combination through December&nbsp;31, 2015, pre-tax compensation expense for these stock
	appreciation rights was $27 ($16 after tax). The expense is reported within &#147;staff costs&#148; in the consolidated income statement. Of the $1,260 liability associated with these stock appreciation rights at December&nbsp;31, 2015, $991 is
	included in current liabilities and $269 is included in other non-current liabilities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	d. Unearned compensation expense
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company has no unearned pre-tax compensation expense related to non-vested
	liability classified stock options as all awards were fully vested. Unearned compensation expense represents the minimum expense to be recognized over the grant date vesting terms or earlier as a result of accelerated expense recognition due to
	remeasurement of compensation cost for liability classified awards. Future expense may exceed the unearned compensation expense in the future due to the remeasurement of liability classified awards. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company has
	unearned pre-tax compensation expense of $35 and $585 related to non-vested equity classified stock options and restricted stock grants, which will be recognized over a weighted average term of 1.31 and 4.90 years, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<U>
	21. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Tax matters
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The components of current and deferred income tax expense (benefit) are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TR>

<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>

<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;

<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The functional currency of the subsidiary FerroAtl&aacute;ntica de Venezuela,
	S.A. is the U.S. dollar (see Note 4.13). In 2015 and 2014, the carrying amount of its non-current assets and inventories was similar to that of previous years, while the tax value of these items decreased as a result of the currency devaluation. The
	difference between the carrying amounts and the tax values of the related deferred tax assets and liabilities results in income tax of $16,877 and $36,268. This impact is included in Other non-taxable income/(expense).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	A tax benefit of $3,029 was recorded in 2014 due to a reduction in the Spanish statutory tax rate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Foreign non-deductible loss reflects the impact of excluding the benefit from certain jurisdictional pre-tax losses as the tax
	credit carryforward may not be recoverable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Deferred taxes
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The changes in deferred tax assets and liabilities in 2015 and 2014 were as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Under current legislation, tax returns cannot be deemed final until they have been audited by
	the tax authorities or until the statute-of-limitations has expired. The number of open tax years subject to examination varies depending on the tax jurisdiction. In general, the Company has the last four years open to review.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In 2015, the Spanish tax authorities notified the Company of an income tax audit of various Spanish subsidiaries for 2010,
	2011 and 2012. Additionally, in 2015 the French tax authorities notified the Company of an income tax audit of various French subsidiaries for 2012, 2013 and 2014. The criteria that the tax authorities might adopt in relation to the years open for
	review could give rise to tax liabilities which cannot be quantified. The Company believes any liabilities resulting from the Spanish and French tax audits should not be material.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-55
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage153"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<U>
	22. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Related party transactions and balances
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2013 the Company had long-term loans granted to Grupo Villar Mir, S.A.U. related mainly to renewable cash
	loans earning interest at a market rate and maturing at long term. These loans were offset as part of the dividend distributed on December&nbsp;29, 2014 (see Note 13).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The short-term loans granted by related parties to Grupo Villar Mir, S.A. (Sole-Shareholder
	Company) relate mainly to renewable cash loans earning interest at a market rate and maturing at short term.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The loans
	granted to Inmobiliaria Espacio, S.A. relate mainly, on the one hand, to the balances payable arising from the consolidated income tax returns filed by several related parties as part of the consolidated tax group headed by Inmobiliaria Espacio,
	S.A. while Grupo FerroAtl&aacute;ntica was part of that.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	A current member of the board of directors is affiliated with
	Marco International, from which the Company purchases certain raw materials and to whom the Company sells silicon-based alloys.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The balances with the other related parties arose as a result of the commercial transactions performed with them (see
	explanation of main transactions below).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Transactions with related parties and other related parties
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Transactions with related parties in 2015, 2014 and 2013 are as follows:
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#147;Cost of sales&#148; of the related parties vis-&agrave;-vis Villar Mir Energ&iacute;a,
	S.L. (Sole-Shareholder Company) relates to the purchase of energy from the latter by the Company&#146;s Electrometallurgy Segment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#147;Sales&#148; relates to energy generated and sold to En&eacute;rgya VM Generaci&oacute;n, S.L. at market prices.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#147;Other operating expenses&#148; relates to service fees paid to Villar Mir Energia, S.L.U. for managing and supervising
	the day-to-day operations of Company hydroelectric facilities in Spain.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<U>
	23.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Guarantee commitments to third
	parties and other contingent assets and liabilities
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>

	liabilities

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company had provided the following guarantees for its subsidiaries:
</P>

	&nbsp;

	In addition to the foregoing, at
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013 the subsidiary FerroAtl&aacute;ntica, S.A. (Sole-Shareholder Company) had provided guarantees for $14,105, $4,565 and $2,260, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, Hidro Nitro Espa&ntilde;ola, S.A. had provided third-party guarantees amounting to
	$7,190, $3,946 and $4,940, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013 Cuarzos Industriales, S.A. had provided
	third-party guarantees for other companies amounting to approximately $1,303, $1,453, and $1,671, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	At
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, Silicon Smelters (Pty.) Ltd. had provided third-party guarantees amounting to approximately $2,894, $2,160 and $2,713 , respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	No other subsidiaries have provided any material guarantees to third parties.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Management believes that any unforeseen liabilities at December&nbsp;31, 2015 that might arise from the guarantees given would
	not be material.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-57
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage155"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Contingent assets
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In 2008, the Company made an investment in a Joint Venture in order to obtain certain operating rights in Brazil. However an
	arbitration process was launched in 2009, claiming the reimbursement of the total amount invested. In 2010, the seller filed an appeal which temporarily suspended the arbitration proceedings. In 2013, the Brazilian arbitration authorities resumed
	the arbitration proceedings and a hearing was held in April 2015, from which the Company is awaiting a ruling from the Arbitration Court. The Company expects a ruling within the next fiscal year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Considering the conditions under which the investment recovery process is being carried out and the uncertainty as to the
	amount that will be recovered, due to the likely insolvency of the other party, and the doubts concerning when the amounts relating to the investment will be reimbursed, the Company recognized an impairment loss on the carrying amount of these
	financial assets at that date, which was written down in full. The amount claimed from the other party is $22,000 less the necessary costs incurred (with a limit of $5,000). At December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company considered that these factors
	casting doubt on the recoverability of the investment still prevailed and, therefore, they considered it reasonable to maintain the carrying amount of the aforementioned investment at zero; however, the aforementioned process will continue for the
	purpose of recovering as much as possible of the total amount invested.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Lastly, Exchange differences during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 are primarily due to
	the effect of the devaluation of the foreign exchange of VEF/USD in 2015 amounting $22,306, and the appreciation of the EUR/USD amounting $7,961, the EUR/ZAR amounting $2,498 and EUR/CNY amounting $2,406 and other &#147;exchange differences&#148;
	amounting $732.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

	24.5 Impairment losses and net (loss) gain due to changes in the value of assets

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	No loans, advances or termination benefits have been granted to key management personnel.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<U>
	26.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Financial risk management policy
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Company&#146;s activities are carried out through its operating segments and are exposed to several financial risks: market
	risk (including foreign currency risk, interest rate risk and price risk), credit risk, liquidity risk and capital risk.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Company&#146;s management model aims to minimize the potential adverse impact of such risks upon the Company&#146;s
	financial performance. Risk is managed by the Company&#146;s Corporate Finance Department, which is responsible for identifying and evaluating financial risks in conjunction with the Company&#146;s operating segments, quantifying them by project,
	region and subsidiary. Management provides written policies for global risk management, as well as for specific areas such as foreign currency risk, credit risk, interest rate risk, liquidity risk, the use of hedging instruments and derivatives, and
	investment of surplus liquidity.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Each of the financial risks to which the Company is exposed in carrying out its business
	activities is detailed as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	a) Market risk
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Market risk arises when the Company&#146;s activities expose it to the financial risks of changes in foreign exchange rates,
	interest rates and the fair value of certain raw materials.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	To hedge such exposure, the Company uses forward foreign
	currency contracts and interest rate swaps. The Company does not generally use derivative financial instruments for speculative purposes.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Foreign currency risk: the Company&#146;s international activity generates exposure to foreign currency risk.
	Foreign currency risk arises when future commercial transactions and assets and liabilities are denominated in a currency other than the functional currency of the Company that performs the transaction or recognizes the asset or liability. The main
	exposure for the Company to foreign currency risk is that relating to the US dollar against the euro.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Forward foreign currency contracts are used for the purpose of controlling foreign currency risk.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-60
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage158"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Details of the financial instruments related to foreign currency collections and
	payments at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 are included in Note 18 to these consolidated financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Interest rate risk: this risk arises mainly from financial liabilities at floating interest rates.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Company actively manages its risk exposure to interest rate risk, to mitigate its exposure to
	changes in interest rates arising from the borrowings arranged with floating interest rates.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In corporate financing
	arrangements, hedges are generally arranged for the total amount and term of the respective financing, through option contracts and/or swaps.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In this regard, the main exposure for the Company to interest rate risk is that relating to the floating interest rate tied to
	Euribor.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	To mitigate interest rate risk, the Company primarily uses swaps, which, in exchange for a fee, offer protection
	against an increase in interest rates.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Details of the interest rate derivative financial instruments at December&nbsp;31,
	2015 and 2014 are included in Note 18 to these consolidated financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	b) Credit risk
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Credit risk arises when a third party fails to comply with its contractual obligations. In this regard, the
	Company&#146;s main credit risk exposure relates to the following items:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Trade and other receivables: The Company insures its trade receivables to mitigate credit risk.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Investments considered to be cash and cash equivalents: the Company exercises prudence in its investment
	policy. The main objectives of the principles in its investment policy are to mitigate the credit risk and liquidity risk of the investments and the counterparty risk of the financial institutions.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	c) Liquidity risk
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The purpose of the Company&#146;s liquidity and financing policy is to ensure that the Company keeps sufficient funds available
	to meet its financial obligations. The Company uses three main sources of financing:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Long term financing arrangements which are generally used to finance the operations of any significant
	subsidiary. The debt repayment profiles are established based on the capacity of each business to generate funds, allowing for variability depending on the expected cash flows for each business. Each long term contract usually provides for lines to
	finance working capital requirements at the operating subsidiary level. This ensures that sufficient financing is available to meet deadlines and maturities, which significantly mitigates liquidity risk.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Parent company financing, which is mainly used to provide liquidity for the operations of the company as a
	whole, and to finance start up projects that require the initial support of the parent company.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	The Company arranges firm commitments from leading financial institutions to purchase trade receivables
	through non-recourse factoring arrangements. Under these agreements, the Company pays a fee to the bank for assuming its credit risk, plus interest on the financing received.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	To ensure there are sufficient funds available to repay its debt in relation to its cash-generating capacity, each year the
	Company&#146;s Financial Planning Department prepares a Financial Budget that is approved by the Management Committee and details all financing needs and how such financing will be provided. The Budget projects the funds necessary for the most
	significant cash requirements, such as prepayments for capital expenditures, debt repayments and, where applicable, working capital requirements. In addition, the Company generally does not allocate its own equity in projects until the associated
	long-term financing is obtained.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Accordingly, the Company diversifies its sources of financing in order to prevent
	concentrations that may expose its working capital to liquidity risk.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-61
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage159"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	d) Capital risk
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Refer to Note 13 (Equity) for information regarding share capital, capital management, dividends, and non-controlling
	interests.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	e) Quantitative information
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	i.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<I>
	Analysis of sensitivity to interest rates
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Changes in the market value of the interest rate derivatives arranged by the Company depend on the changes in the Euribor
	yield curve and long-term swaps. The market value of these derivatives at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 was $9,378 and $10,467, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

	curve:

	Since June&nbsp;30, 2015, our hedges have been considered ineffective under hedge accounting,
	and as a result the changes in market value of these derivatives are recognized in the consolidated income statement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The
	Company also performed a sensitivity analysis of the amounts of the floating rate borrowings which indicated that an increase of 0.5% in interest rates would give rise to additional borrowing costs of $1,200 in 2015 and $1,400 in 2014.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<I>
	Analysis of sensitivity to exchange rates
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The changes in the market value of the foreign currency derivatives arranged by the Company depend mainly on the changes in
	the USD/EUR spot rate and on the evolution of forward points curve. The market value of these derivatives at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 was -&#128;900 for the EUR/USD position and -&#128;3,300&nbsp;million in 2014, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-62
</P>

	foreign currency derivatives is as follows:

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Foreign currency derivatives mainly cover monetary items in the statement of financial
	position and, therefore, the exchange differences are offset by the differences in value of the derivatives in profit or loss for the year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<U>
	27. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other disclosures
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Restricted net asset
</B>
<B>
	s
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Certain of our entities are restricted from remitting certain funds to us in the form of cash dividends or loans by a variety
	of regulations, contractual or statutory requirements. These restrictions are related to standard covenant requirements included in our bank borrowings. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, the accumulated amount of the restrictions for the whole restricted
	term of these affiliates was approximately $363,000. The Company expects in the future to extract cash from the entities and to pay dividends to their shareholders. The Company performed a test on the restricted net assets of combined subsidiaries
	in accordance with Securities and Exchange Commission Regulation rule 5-04 (c)&nbsp;&#145;what schedules are to be filed&#146; and concluded the restricted net assets exceed 25% of the consolidated net assets of the Company at December&nbsp;31,
	2015. Therefore the separate condensed financial statements, as per SEC rule S-X 12-04, of Ferroglobe PLC are presented (see Appendix II, considered to be part of the footnotes, for details.)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Other significant information in regards to the Parent Company are as follows:

	F-63
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage161"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Other information
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 the Parent is not responsible for certain bank borrowings received by their subsidiaries.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Predecessor was responsible for certain bank borrowings received by their subsidiaries. At
	December&nbsp;31, 2014, the detail, by maturity, of the non-current bank borrowings is as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In addition to the above, the Parent Company held no material contingency or guarantee at
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014. Likewise, Parent Company did not have any provision for long-term obligations, nor mandatory dividend or redemption requirements of redeemable stock.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<U>
	28. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Events after the reporting period
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	On February&nbsp;3, 2016, our Board of Directors approved a quarterly dividend of $0.08 per share, which was paid on
	March&nbsp;14, 2016 to shareholders of record at the close of business on February&nbsp;26, 2016.
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage164"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Appendix II
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Schedule I has been provided pursuant to the requirements of Rule 12- 04(a) of Regulation S-X, of the US Securities and Exchange Commission
	(SEC) which require condensed financial information as to the financial position, change in financial position, results of operations of Ferroglobe PLC, other comprehensive (loss) income statement and cash flow statement as of the same dates and for
	the same periods for which audited consolidated financial statements have been presented when the restricted net assets of consolidated subsidiaries exceed 25 percent of consolidated net assets as of the end of the most recently completed fiscal
	year. Other comprehensive (loss) income statement is not applicable for the periods presented.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Certain information and footnote
	disclosures normally included in financial statements prepared in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards have been condensed or omitted. The footnote disclosures contain supplemental information only and, as such, these
	statements should be read in conjunction with the notes to the accompanying consolidated financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Basis of Presentation.
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The presentation of Ferroglobe PLC stand-alone condensed financial statement has been prepared using the same accounting policies as set out in
	the accompanying consolidated financial statements except that, in the stand alone condensed financial statements the investments in subsidiaries are being recorded under the equity method of accounting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

	F-66

<A NAME="eolPage169"></A>
<A NAME="D158678DEX121_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_12>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_12"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 12.1
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	CERTIFICATION
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	I, Alan Kestenbaum, certify that:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	1. I have reviewed this annual report on Form 20-F of Ferroglobe PLC;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	2. Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact
	necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	3. Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in
	all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the company as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	4. The company&#146;s other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls
	and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) for the company and have:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	(a) Designed such
	disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the company, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by
	others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	(b) [Omitted in
	accordance with Exchange Act Rule 13a-14(a)];
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	(c) Evaluated the effectiveness of the company&#146;s disclosure controls
	and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	(d) Disclosed in this report any change in the company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during
	the period covered by the annual report that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	5. The company&#146;s other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control
	over financial reporting, to the company&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of the company&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	(a) All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial
	reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the company&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	(b) Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the
	company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Date: May 2, 2016
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<EFX_EXHIBIT_12>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_12_2"></A>

<B>
	Exhibit 12.2
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	CERTIFICATION
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	I, Joseph Ragan, certify that:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	1. I have reviewed this annual report on Form 20-F of Ferroglobe PLC;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	2. Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact
	necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	3. Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in
	all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the company as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	4. The company&#146;s other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls
	and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) for the company and have:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	(a) Designed such
	disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the company, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by
	others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	(b) [Omitted in
	accordance with Exchange Act Rule 13a-14(a)];
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	(c) Evaluated the effectiveness of the company&#146;s disclosure controls
	and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	(d) Disclosed in this report any change in the company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during
	the period covered by the annual report that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	5. The company&#146;s other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control
	over financial reporting, to the company&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of the company&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	(a) All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial
	reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the company&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	(b) Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the
	company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

<EFX_EXHIBIT_13>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_13"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	Exhibit 13.1
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	18 U.S.C. SECTION 1350,
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO SECTION 906
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Each of the undersigned hereby certifies, for the purposes of section 1350 of chapter 63 of title 18 of the United States Code, as adopted
	pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, in his capacity as an officer of Ferroglobe PLC (&#147;Ferroglobe&#148;), that, to his knowledge, the Annual Report of Ferroglobe on Form 20-F for the period ended December&nbsp;31,
	2015, fully complies with the requirements of Section&nbsp;13(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and that the information contained in such report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of
	Ferroglobe. This written statement is being furnished to the Securities and Exchange Commission as an exhibit to such Form 20-F. A signed original of this statement has been provided to Ferroglobe and will be retained by Ferroglobe and furnished to
	the Securities and Exchange Commission or its staff upon request.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Date: May 2, 2016
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD WIDTH="92%">

	By:

	&nbsp;
</TD>
